Generate Appendix for Research Measures

boilerplate_measures.Rd

This function generates a formatted appendix describing research measures, including baseline variables, exposure variables, and outcome variables. It can handle both individual measures and scales with multiple dimensions, and includes optional keywords for each measure and custom titles.

Usage

boilerplate_measures(
  all_vars = NULL,
  baseline_vars = NULL,
  exposure_var = NULL,
  outcome_vars = NULL,
  measure_data,
  custom_titles = NULL,
  print_keywords = FALSE,
  print_waves = FALSE
)

Arguments

all_vars

A logical value or a character vector. If TRUE, outputs all unique variables from baseline_vars, exposure_var, and outcome_vars. If a character vector, it replaces the need for separate baseline_vars, exposure_var, and outcome_vars.

baseline_vars

A character vector of baseline variable names (optional if all_vars is provided).

exposure_var

A single character string naming the exposure variable (optional if all_vars is provided).

outcome_vars

A character vector of outcome variable names (optional if all_vars is provided).

measure_data

A list containing information about each measure. Each element should be a list with at least 'description' and 'reference' fields. Optional fields include 'waves', 'items' for scale dimensions, and 'keywords'.

custom_titles

An optional named list of custom titles for measures.

print_keywords

A logical value indicating whether to print keywords. Default is FALSE.

print_waves

A logical value indicating whether to print wave information. Default is FALSE.

Value

A character string containing the formatted appendix text.
